p:
Bone marrow suppression is the most common adverse effect of valganciclovir. Gastrointestinal manifestations, such as diarrhea, nausea, and vomiting, may be observed. Resistance to valganciclovir occurs through mechanisms identical to those underlying ganciclovir resistance, ie, through mutations in the UL97 gene, which encodes for CMV kinase, and the UL54 gene, which encodes for CMV DNA polymerase.
